content: The iconic Hollywood sign originally read "Hollywoodland" when it was first erected in 1923. It was built to advertise a new housing development in which city?

The iconic Hollywood sign, which originally read "Hollywoodland," was first erected in 1923. It was built to advertise a new housing development in the city of Los Angeles, California. The sign was intended to be a temporary advertisement for the "Hollywoodland" real estate project, but it has since become an internationally recognized symbol of the American film industry.
